metadata.name: PUA - Wsudo Suspicious Execution
metadata.comment: Detects usage of wsudo (Windows Sudo Utility). Which is a tool that let the user execute programs with different permissions (System, Trusted Installer, Administrator...etc)

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\wsudo.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('wsudo.exe') AND lower(device.desc) = lower('windows sudo utility') AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\wsudo-bridge.exe')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-u system')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-usystem')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-u trustedinstaller')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-utrustedinstaller')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' --ti '))))

output.summary: Detects usage of wsudo (Windows Sudo Utility). Which is a tool that let the user execute programs with different permissions (System, Trusted Installer, Administrator...etc)
